[[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] |image = Professor Sir Roy George Douglas Allen, c1978.jpg |image_size = |caption = Allen in 1978. |birth_date = {{birth date|df=y|1906|6|3}} |birth_place = [[Stoke-on-Trent]], [[Staffordshire]], [[England]] |death_date = {{Death date and age|df=y|1983|9|29|1906|6|3}}{{cite book|url=http://books.google.ca/books?id=Ecw2AQAAIAAJ&q=%22allen,+roy+george+douglas%22&dq=%22allen,+roy+george+douglas%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=KVrrT-qpGse7rQGDg8jFBQ&ved=0CEUQ6AEwBA |title=The New Palgrave: a dictionary of economics - Sir Robert Harry Inglis Palgrave - Google Books |publisher=Books.google.ca |date= |accessdate=2012-06-27}} |death_place = [[Southwold]], [[Suffolk, England]] |residence = |citizenship = |nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] |ethnicity = [[English people|English]] |field = [[Statistics]] |work_institutions = [[London School of Economics]] |alma_mater = [[University of Cambridge]] |doctoral_advisor = |doctoral_students = |known_for = [[Elasticity of substitution|Partial elasticity of substitution]] |author_abbrev_bot = |author_abbrev_zoo = |influences = |influenced = |prizes = [[Guy Medal]] {{small|(Gold, 1978)}} |religion = |footnotes = |signature = }} '''Sir Roy George Douglas Allen''', [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]], [[British Academy|FBA]] (3 June 1906 – 29 September 1983) was an English [[economics|economist]], [[mathematician]] and [[statistician]]. == Persons == Allen was born in [[Worcester, England|Worcester]] and educated at the [[Royal Grammar School Worcester]], from which he won a scholarship to [[Sidney Sussex College, Cambridge]]. He gained a [[First Class Honours]] in [[Mathematics]]. He became a lecturer at the [[London School of Economics]] (LSE) later becoming Professor of Statistics. He wrote many papers and books on mathematical economics including the famous paper on ''A Reconsideration of the Theory of Value'' published in ''[[Economics]]'' in 1934 with Sir [[John Hicks]]. Other books include: ''Mathematical Analysis for Economists'' (1938), ''Statistics for Economists'' (1949), ''Mathematical Economics'' (1956), and ''Macroeconomic Theory'' (1967). Allen was [[Knight Bachelor|knighted]] in 1966 for his services to economics and became president of the [[Royal Statistical Society]], who awarded him the [[Guy Medal]] in Gold in 1978. He was also treasurer of the [[British Academy]] of which he was a fellow (FBA). He introduced the concept of "[[elasticity of substitution|partial elasticity of substitution]]" to economics in his famous 1938 book "''Mathematical Analysis for Economists''". Allen became a fellow of Sidney Sussex, Cambridge and died in 1983.
